content.description: Fun warm up. When people say "jugs for days" this is problem you will think of. Very cool sandstone Hueco that look like the toxic symbol where the name came from
content.location: This is the right most problem at the JMA boulder. It is a very easy problem to spot since there are 3 huge Huecos that connect. Start left hand on the start of the nutcracker traverse and right kind of high. Finish on the top left crimp with a match

content.description: If you a real looking for a long boulder traverse this is it! The feet are very bad at the beginning  but stay high. Crux is definitely the first 15ft or so.
content.protection: Be sure to have multiple crash pads and a spotter to keep moving them down the wall
content.location: The problem starts on the far right of the boulder just to the left of Toxic on a leftward facing jug match start. Traverse all the way to the start of Black Foot.

content.description: The crux of the route is about half way up. The start is a little tricky but core up and push through it. Very fun problem
content.location: This problem is on the JAM boulder. As soon as you walk up to the boulder you will see two vertical jugs that are about 2 feet long. Start on the right of the two jugs, traverse left to the other then up right a little and finish to the top left on the ledge

content.description: Very fun problem if you are still in between warming up and not fully warmed up. Good crimps nothing is too bad but there is no jugs on the problem
content.location: Start just to the right of Black Foot on two crimps, go strait up the boulder until you match at the ledge. There might even be a heel hook somewhere in there
